text:
33% does feel sky high! I'd say closer to 3% personally. 

Taxes? Accountant does that. 
Emails? Everything is done in DMs on various platforms. I actively unsubscribe to anything and everything that could even Be close to junk. 
Pitching? I don't cold pitch anything but when people come to me, I have a template with services and pricing to send back to them. Saves me getting involved with clients who aren't serious. I'm sure a template would help you here too. 
Admin? The only admin I can think of is sending invoices which takes about a minute!

elements.text: 33% does feel sky high! I'd say closer to 3% personally.

Taxes? Accountant does that. 
Emails? Everything is done in DMs on various platforms. I actively unsubscribe to anything and everything that could even Be close to junk. 
Pitching? I don't cold pitch anything but when people come to me, I have a template with services and pricing to send back to them. Saves me getting involved with clients who aren't serious. I'm sure a template would help you here too. 
Admin? The only admin I can think of is sending invoices which takes about a minute!

text: Do you work with a lot of consistent clients, or are you doing a lot of one offs? Anchor clients take less admin work, as you'll have billing and pitching processes down to just replicate easily each month. I would separate our pitching from that number and look at how much pitching you need to do to earn a good income. While giving feedback and ideas for upcoming articles and projects can take time, most of my better clients assign work and I don't do brainstorming. If you are doing much brainstorming or pitching, you may need to ask for payment for that portion. I honestly don't pitch much outside of journalism these days.

I would separate our pitching from that number and look at how much pitching you need to do to earn a good income. While giving feedback and ideas for upcoming articles and projects can take time, most of my better clients assign work and I don't do brainstorming. If you are doing much brainstorming or pitching, you may need to ask for payment for that portion. I honestly don't pitch much outside of journalism these days.

text: This is a great point. Turning free work into paid work is key to reducing that 33%.
